items.name: Component_Sprite
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_Sprite extends gs.Component_Visual ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> @setupEventHandlers() ###* * A sprite component to display an object on screen. It can be managed or * unmanaged. A managed sprite is automatically added to the graphics-system * and rendered every frame until it gets disposed. An unmanaged sprite needs * to be added and removed manually. * * @module gs * @class Component_Sprite * @extends gs.Component_Visual * @memberof gs * @constructor * @param {boolean} managed - Indicates if the sprite is managed by the graphics system. ### constructor: (managed) -> super() ###* * The native sprite object to display the game object on screen. * * @property sprite * @type Sprite * @protected ### @sprite = null ###* * The name of the image to display. * * @property image * @type string * @protected ### @image = null ###* * The name of the video to display. * * @property video * @type string * @protected ### @video = null ###* * The name of the folder from where the image should be loaded. * * @property image * @type string * @protected ### @imageFolder = "Graphics/Pictures" ###* * The visibility. If false, the sprite is not rendered. * * @property visible * @type boolean * @protected ### @visible = no ###* * Indicates if the image is loaded. * * @property imageLoaded * @type boolean * @protected ### @imageLoaded = no ###* * Disposes the sprite. If the sprite is managed, it will be automatically * removed from the graphics system and viewport. * @method dispose ### dispose: -> super if @sprite @sprite.dispose() if @sprite.video @sprite.video.stop() if not @sprite.managed @sprite.viewport?.removeGraphicObject(@sprite) Graphics.viewport?.removeGraphicObject(@sprite) ###* * Adds event-handlers for mouse/touch events * * @method setupEventHandlers ### setupEventHandlers: -> @sprite.onIndexChange = => @object.rIndex = @sprite.index @object.needsUpdate = yes ###* * Setup the sprite. * @method setupSprite ### setupSprite: -> if !@sprite @sprite = new gs.Sprite(Graphics.viewport, managed ? yes) ###* * Setup the sprite component. This method is automatically called by the * system. * @method setup ### setup: -> @isSetup = yes @setupSprite() @setupEventHandlers() @update() ###* * Updates the source- and destination-rectangle of the game object so that * the associated bitmap fits in. The imageHandling property controls how * the rectangles are resized. * @method updateRect ### updateRect: -> if @sprite.bitmap? if !@object.imageHandling @object.srcRect = new Rect(0, 0, @sprite.bitmap.width, @sprite.bitmap.height) if not @object.fixedSize @object.dstRect.width = @object.srcRect.width @object.dstRect.height = @object.srcRect.height else if @object.imageHandling == 1 @object.srcRect = new Rect(0, 0, @sprite.bitmap.width, @sprite.bitmap.height / 2) if not @object.fixedSize @object.dstRect.width = @object.srcRect.width @object.dstRect.height = @object.srcRect.height else if @object.imageHandling == 2 if not @object.fixedSize @object.dstRect.width = @object.srcRect.width @object.dstRect.height = @object.srcRect.height ###* * Updates the bitmap object from the associated image name. The imageFolder * property controls from which resource-folder the image will be loaded. * @method updateBitmap ### updateBitmap: -> @imageLoaded = no @image = @object.image if @object.image?.startsWith("data:") || @object.image?.startsWith("$") @sprite.bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap(@object.image) else @sprite.bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap("#{@object.imageFolder||@imageFolder}/#{@object.image}") if @sprite.bitmap? if not @imageLoaded @imageLoaded = @sprite.bitmap.loaded else delete @sprite.bitmap.loaded_ @object.bitmap = @sprite.bitmap ###* * Updates the video object from the associated video name. It also updates * the video-rendering process. * @method updateVideo ### updateVideo: -> if @object.video != @videoName @videoName = @object.video @sprite.video = ResourceManager.getVideo("#{@object.videoFolder ? "Movies"}/#{@object.video}") if @sprite.video? if $PARAMS.preview?.settings.musicDisabled @sprite.video.volume = 0 @sprite.video.loop = @object.loop @sprite.video.play() @object.srcRect = new Rect(0, 0, @sprite.video.width, @sprite.video.height) if not @object.fixedSize @object.dstRect = new Rect(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @sprite.video.width, @sprite.video.height) @sprite.video?.update() ###* * Updates the image if the game object has the image-property set. * @method updateImage ### updateImage: -> if @object.image? if @object.image != @image or (!@imageLoaded and @sprite.bitmap?.loaded) @updateBitmap() @updateRect() else if @object.bitmap? @sprite.bitmap = @object.bitmap else if @object.video? or @videoName != @object.video @updateVideo() else @image = null @object.bitmap = null @sprite.bitmap = null ###* * If the sprite is unmanaged, this method will update the visibility of the * sprite. If the sprite leaves the viewport, it will be removed to save * performance and automatically added back to the viewport if it enters * the viewport. * @method updateVisibility ### updateVisibility: -> if !@sprite.managed visible = Rect.intersect(@object.dstRect.x+@object.origin.x, @object.dstRect.y+@object.origin.y, @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height, 0, 0, Graphics.width, Graphics.height) if visible and !@visible (@object.viewport || Graphics.viewport).addGraphicObject(@sprite) @visible = yes if !visible and @visible (@object.viewport || Graphics.viewport).removeGraphicObject(@sprite) @visible = no ###* * Updates the padding. * @method updatePadding ### updatePadding: -> if @object.padding? @sprite.x += @object.padding.left @sprite.y += @object.padding.top @sprite.zoomX -= (@object.padding.left+@object.padding.right) / @object.srcRect.width @sprite.zoomY -= (@object.padding.bottom+@object.padding.bottom) / @object.srcRect.height ###* * Updates the sprite properties from the game object properties. * @method updateProperties ### updateProperties: -> @sprite.width = @object.dstRect.width @sprite.height = @object.dstRect.height @sprite.x = @object.dstRect.x @sprite.y = @object.dstRect.y @sprite.mask = @object.mask ? @mask @sprite.angle = @object.angle || 0 @sprite.opacity = @object.opacity ? 255 @sprite.clipRect = @object.clipRect @sprite.srcRect = @object.srcRect @sprite.blendingMode = @object.blendMode || 0 @sprite.mirror = @object.mirror @sprite.visible = @object.visible and (!@object.parent or !@object.parent.visible? or @object.parent.visible) @sprite.ox = -@object.origin.x @sprite.oy = -@object.origin.y @sprite.z = (@object.zIndex || 0) + (if !@object.parent then 0 else @object.parent.zIndex || 0) ###* * Updates the optional sprite properties from the game object properties. * @method updateOptionalProperties ### updateOptionalProperties: -> if @object.tone? @sprite.tone = @object.tone if @object.color? @sprite.color = @object.color if @object.viewport? @sprite.viewport = @object.viewport if @object.effects? @sprite.effects = @object.effects if @object.anchor? @sprite.anchor.x = @object.anchor.x @sprite.anchor.y = @object.anchor.y if @object.positionAnchor? @sprite.positionAnchor = @object.positionAnchor if @object.zoom? @sprite.zoomX = @object.zoom.x @sprite.zoomY = @object.zoom.y if @object.motionBlur? @sprite.motionBlur = @object.motionBlur ###* * Updates the sprite component by updating its visibility, image, padding and * properties. * @method update ### update: -> super @setup() if not @isSetup @updateVisibility() @updateImage() @updateProperties() @updateOptionalProperties() @updatePadding() @object.rIndex = @sprite.index @sprite.update() ###* * Enumeration of appearance animations. * * @module gs * @class AnimationTypes * @static * @memberof gs ### class AnimationTypes @initialize: -> ###* * An object appears or disappears by moving into or out of the screen. * @property MOVEMENT * @type number * @static * @final ### @MOVEMENT = 0 ###* * An object appears or disappears using alpha-blending. * @property BLENDING * @type number * @static * @final ### @BLENDING = 1 ###* * An object appears or disappears using a mask-image. * @property MASKING * @type number * @static * @final ### @MASKING = 2 AnimationTypes.initialize() gs.AnimationTypes = AnimationTypes gs.Component_Sprite = Component_Sprite
